title: Importance of Developing Higher Taste | Sri Amitasana Dasa | SB 1.18.32 | 28.07.2024
speaker: HG Amitasana Dasa

segments.text: Translation and purport by His Divine Grace A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Srila Prabhupada
The sage had a son who was very powerful, being a brahmana's son.
While he was playing with the inexperienced boys, he heard of his father's distress, which was occasioned by the king.
Then and there the boy spoke as follows.
Due to Maharaj Pariksit's good government, even a boy of tender age who was playing with his other inexperienced boys could become as powerful as qualified brahmana.
The boy was known as Shringi, and he achieved good training.
In brahmacharya by his father, so that he could be as powerful as a brahmana, even at that age.
But because the age of Kali was seeking an opportunity to spoil the cultural heritage of the four orders of life,
the inexperienced boys gave a chance for the age of Kali to enter into the field of Vedic culture.
Hatred of the lower orders of life began from the brahmana boy under the influence of Kali,
and thus cultural life began to dwindle.
The first victim of brahmana injustice, brahmanical injustice, was Maharaj Pariksit.
And thus the protection given by the king against the onslaught of Kali was slackened.
So just to give you a context of what's being mentioned in this verse.
In the previous verse, Pariksit Maharaj, while he was in the forest,
And since the sage was busy in his meditation, he didn't open his eyes.
He didn't properly receive the king as per the etiquette.
Many leelas which are mentioned in the Bhagavatam,
if we understand in the context of the divine plan of the Lord,
we'll be able to understand them correctly.
One may question, if Pariksit was such a great devotee of the Lord,
Just because he was not received respectfully.
In fact, a devotee of the Lord is very tolerant.
He is more tolerant than a tree.
He is humbler than a blade of grass.
So overall, it's a divine plan of the Lord.

Kali Yuga, Treta Yuga, Satya Yuga, Dwapara Yuga.

and put it around the neck of the Brahmana.

he saw his father being insulted.
He felt very offended and he cursed Pariksit Maharaj.

when there is a strong king like Pariksit Maharaj,
good governance means to protect the citizens,

because we are in the midst of Kali Yuga.

I can give you enough money, so much money that for the rest of the life you can live
You don't have to worry about your finances.

with anyone, including your family, including your near and dear ones. Even

something you can meet. There's some protocols. But here the condition was

man accepted the challenge and he thought
instead of struggling the whole life, it's a struggle for 10 years. I'll somehow manage.

whatever he was expressing, whatever words he was speaking also was being captured, was being shown.
